intro: Pisonia yagua-pinda, commonly known as the Yagua-pinda hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Pisonia yagua-pinda typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters in its natural habitat.
